Reviews.Title: “a little jewel in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline H
Reviews.Content: Being French, I read all the great review about this hotel, and wasn't dissappointed. I brought my mother in-law to Paris and was looking for the perfect little French hotel, Hotel Nicolo was a success! The room and bathroom weren't super big, but enough for a stay, and very cosy. The location is ideal, the breakfast unreal, but most of all, the staff (from the owner to the cleaning lady) were all really really nice... And that's an extra point in Paris! Will defenitly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: BagLadyAtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this wonderful hotel for several nights. The service was outstanding, the rooms spotless and the breakfast superb. We truly had the most wonderful stay here and cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: StarInErbil
Reviews.Content: I was there with family and we all loved it. The location is very good close to 2 metro stations. It is clean the staff are friendly. Wish you a nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: Richard187257
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with character and charm. Offers a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We were charmed - for better and worse”
Reviews.Author: travelot03
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be charming in so many ways - location, decor, service - and our top floor room had a view of the Eiffel Tower. Wonderful breakfast and very friendly staff. We would wholeheartedly recommend this property if we had not been mislead, not once but twice, when we asked for assistance at the front desk. The first occasion we were on our way out to buy a bottle of wine for our room and we asked where a nearby store might be.to purchase wine. The clerk said that the hotel had wine, and before we could ask another question he went to the back and returned with a bottle of red - uncorked, with two glasses on a tray - and announced that it would be 30 EUROs. We were embarrassed at the misunderstanding so asked that it be added to our bill, but did feel uncomfortable that we were now buying a bottle of wine that we had not asked for or chosen. The second incident occurred when we asked if a taxi could be called the next morning for our return to the airport. The hotel offered a car and driver service for a flat rate of 75 EURO, which we declined because it would be a Sunday morning, and a regular taxi would be half the cost. The next morning, when we asked if the taxi had been called we were told yes, and the driver assisted us with our bags to the taxi. Five minutes into the drive to the airport we realized this was not a regular taxi, but the hotel's car service and we were once again feeling manipulated into paying more for something we did not ask for (in the case of the taxi, we had specifically said NO to their car/driver service, but were now finding ourselves trapped). I am very disappointed to share these stories but these incidents left a negative feeling of the hotel for us and marred what would otherwise have been a perfect choice of hotel. Hopefully others will learn from our mistakes and gullibility.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: seam_by_seam
Reviews.Content: Overall, my stay at Hotel Nicolo was great. One of the receptionists was very rude to be honest, but the rest of the staff made up for her. I hurt my foot very badly the first night in Paris, and the staff called a doctor for me in the (early!!) morning when I woke up in pain, and was very kind to me in my distress. The breakfast is really wonderful - croissants, baugettes, yogurt, lots of different fruit, other pastries, eggs, etc. More than enough to fill you up for a day of sightseeing (or lazing about in a cafe sipping wine!) in Paris. They do not have many tables for breakfast though, so I would try to beat the rush by coming down early! But it's nice to sit with a fellow traveler and have a nice chat too, sometimes! The rooms are beautifully decorated, and the beds very comfortable. The rooms are very small though, so keep this in mind. My bathroom was tiny, but I didn't care so much. I never woke up because of any noise, but I am a very heavy sleeper. I especially loved the small garden in the courtyard. It is also in a great area - a grocery store is just down the road, along with an ATM and a pharmacy. I would recommend this hotel to nearly anyone. And you might have a view of the Eiffel tower from your room! All for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Jntz
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is in a very nice location, about 5 - 7 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. Rooms are furnished well and very clean stay. However, hotel is noisy and we woke up several times at night when people are talking in the courtyard, on the phone in front reception or when people checked in and moved their luggage around. Breakfast is a very good continental breakfast and more than enough for the start of the day, however they have 5 tables in the eating area to service all the rooms (approx 40 - if I'm not mistaken). Definitely not enough for people to enjoy breakfast. We had to wait every morning for someone else to rush to finish their breakfast and the staff at front reception were not helpful to make arrangements to eat somewhere else. Not a bad hotel, but I will research other options next time.

Reviews.Title: “ok place in great area of paris”
Reviews.Author: peterah
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel in great area of Paris, nice shops and restaurants around and handy for the centre. Staff are rude and off-hand especially at the breakfast service. Expensive for the service provided.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: tbj17NewYorkMetro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have visited Paris many times but this was our first stay in the 16th. The Nicolo is located in the very pleasant neighborhood of Passy, convenient to the Muette metro stop and excellent grocery shopping near the corner of Rue Nicolo and Rue de la Pompe. Hotel personnel are friendly and efficient, breakfast was excellent and very pleasant. The small garden is a lovely spot to sit and relax. Small room and very small bathroom but perfectly adequate and very clean.....we shall definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: alisontinsley48
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nicolo has it all. Nicely decorated rooms, fantastic staff, excellent free breakfast and great location - plus it's very reasonably priced. We frequently visit Paris and we plan to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris x”
Reviews.Author: DC_HW_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the bank holiday weekend. As it was our first time staying at the hotel, we were slightly apprehensive. But as soon we arrived we were greeted with a warm welcome. We had a brilliant stay at the hotel....the room was clean and comfortable, had a view of the Eiffel Tower......and my girlfriend loved the breakfast :-) We'd definately come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean, with a nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SeraCristina
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 5 nights at Hotel Nicolo on our recent trip to Paris. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel. Rooms were clean, and there is a safe in the room for your use. Staff were quite helpful in terms of providing directions and making recommendations. We thought that the breakfast provided was great! A perfect start to our day. We liked the fact that the hotel is smaller and has a "family-run" kind of feel to it. In terms of location, it is close to the Eiffel Tower, but quite a walk to any other attractions. However, it is located between two subway stops (Passy and La Muette) so it is quite accessible by metro.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: AussieKC03
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2nights over a weekend. Excellent proximity for a visit to the Eiffel Tower. Just a 10-15mins walk to Passy or Trocadero Metro stations for easy access to the rest of the city. Some shops and restaurants (including trusty McDonalds with its free wi-fi) within easy walking distance. The area in general felt quite safe, although when coming home from Trocadero late on sat night I did catch a taxi. I was all prepared to walk but the souvenir guys suggested it was better not to walk by myself (me being a youngish female). Hotel is inviting with its lovely garden and courtyard. My room was on the 2nd floor, overlooking the courtyard. Whilst not a massive room, it is decorated tastefully and is very welcoming. No minibar or air-conditioning, but is equipped with a TV (loads of French TV), ceiling fan, safe. It is nice and quiet, and exceptionally clean. Lovely queen size bed for a single room. Private bathroom was on the small and functional side, but workable nonetheless. Not much room in the toilet alcove (if you’re a taller person your knees may touch the wall in front!). No screen on the shower entrance but for me that didn’t cause excessive water on the floor. Lovely selection of toiletries provided. Being a central location in Paris, some rooms are located in close proximity to each other, the stairwell or the lift. I did hear some muffled noise during the night, but nothing significant. The only reason I have mentioned it is for the very light sleepers (and I would use ear plugs rather than find somewhere else though!). No noise was audible from outside of the hotel - lovely for such a central location! Continental b/fast was included in my room rate (Single room promo rate of €85 per night). Selection of seasonal fruits, pastries, yoghurts and cereals, in addition to being served individually with my own croissants, breadsticks, jams and tea/coffee. Certainly an ample breakfast to start the day (although not the selection of meats and cheeses you may be used to at other hotels). The Hotel does offer a limited selection of drinks as well. Finally, service provided by Hotel Nicol staff was excellent, and always available on the 24hour reception desk. Joseph was very willing to provide advice on how to maximise my stay, and with a touch of Parisian humour too! Marc helped me out with further advice on the Metro, etc. The hotel will happily store your bags for you as well. The housekeeping and serving staff were always polite and went about their business quietly, with no fuss. To sum up – for easy access to Eiffel Tower (I took some marvellous night time photos) and surrounding areas, Hotel Nicol is a clean, comfortable and easy choice to stay in Paris. Don’t let the 2 star rating deter you from Hotel Nicolo.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: SheMadBird
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nicolo is, overall, a good hotel in Paris. It's located near two subways stations, a few stores and a small shopping mall with a supermarket; the area itself is good, and we felt comfortable and safe. The breakfast was ok, but there was nothing special about it like I read in other comments. You get good quality bread, butter, jams and cheese; no ham or hot food. The rooms are small, but not to small and are OK by Paris standards; they are clean, so that's a big plus. You do have a little elevator but we thought it charming and had no problem on going up a few stairs. The staff is friendly and the internet access is good (Wi-fi), although it's not free, it's only 3 euros for the length of your stay. The negative was just the bathroom, it's very small and there is no shower curtain, so, although this might not seem a problem at first, the fact is that the bathroom floor gets wet and the door of the bathroom is damaged because of it. You have a safety deposit box, but no refrigerator. All in all it was a good stay, but sadly I cannot compare it to other hotels in Paris, since I don't know any. I just think that the price, around 150 euros a night in early June, might be a little expensive for the amenities you get, but, on the other hand it's a good clean room and nothing really wrong about it, so why risk staying in another hotel with negative comments?

Reviews.Title: “Splendid location, customer care and enjoyed everything about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LePotier
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 6-28 till 7-6. Single room on 4th floor and could see top 10% of E tower at the right angle (not important). Locale- Passy is mostly residential neighborhood. Always felt safe. Metro to Passy stop easy downhill 7 minute walk, further 15 minutes walk to E tower. Food store around corner - INNO in Passy plaza. Try good sushi rest. across from hotel. Also, Susan's on Rue d'annuciation (sp?) serves Great Tex-Mex (i am from texas and can assure this is good). Ask anyone about the location, she's been there a long time. Room- I stayed in a single. Comfortable bed and chair, desk and drawers all more than sufficent for a longer stay than mine (8 nights). Good lighting in room and ceiling fan, no A/C but that was Ok because the weather was great when I stayed. Shower/sink/toilet keep spotless, suggest a shower curtain though for splash. Room with safe and ample shelves and hangers. 3euro for WIFI during entire stay, not per day. Computer in lobby available too. Desk staff. From the minute I arrived, everyone of the people I dealt with was very helpful and quite friendly. When I had specific questions on places to visit, I was handed printouts of their search results. When I had a ticket to print, was able to email it to desk and it was printed within 3 minutes. Clouette (i think that is her name) was cheerful and as an intern in the business has a great future. They have a genuine concern for your comfort and satisfaction, no doubt. Food- Yes the breakfast was great, ample breads, fresh fruit, Great coffee, cereals, youghurt, pasteries, juices. Eat in the courtyard, quiet oasis of flowers and plants. Can't complain about any aspect of my stay, even the PetitJean (small elevator) only big enough for me and my bag or a couple very much in love. Al in all, I WILL stay here again and reccomend this to others wanting comfort and good location for a reasonable price. This place is a prize.

Reviews.Title: “Good if no other room available in whole paris”
Reviews.Author: sonjag26
Reviews.Content: 2 star hotel in neighborhood close to Eiffel Tower. Close to metrostation. When we arrived we where surprised by the smell of chemical odorisant Airw.... and found an automatic spray behind the entrance door. I cannot understand why a hotel installs such a horrible smell in a room. All these chemical products are giving cancer. We had to leave during day and night the windows open and baught a natural organic spray to be able to stay in the room. The room is big too Parisian standards, decoration is old fashioned from the 90's. Many noises from watercolons of other rooms. Breakfast is good with croissants, very good bread but fruit has no taste and pastry is industrial. Conclusion ; this hotel is too expensive 240 euros for a triple room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Terri97
Reviews.Content: An absolutely charming little hotel in Passy with a beautiful garden! Uninviting from the street, when you walk through the small passageway to the hotel, you are blown away by the lovely, garden setting. Nice quiet rooms, good service, very nice breakfast A stone's throw from the Eiffel tower and s short walk to the Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe. The Rue de Passy is just around the corner with great shopping! The Nicolo is truly a hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “A real hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Internationalsmurf Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: One often hears that the French are rude but this hotel and its staff have called the statements accuracy into question. Absolutely amazing staff. Very helpful and always with a smile on their face. Fantastic breakfast, Internet service in your room for 3 Euro for the length of your stay, within a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and well connected to the Metro system. The neighborhood also has many restaurants, cafes, and lots of shopping. We scored a promotional deal and it ended up being very reasonably priced to top it all off. Even at full price I would recommend it to romantic couples as a reasonable and charming place to spend your nights and mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Margaret12Nelson
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here on the recommendation of NZ friends, and it was a very pleasant experience. The reception staff were always helpful, the breakfasts were fresh and delicious, the location was excellent - whether for walking to nearby restaurants and parks or for getting the metro to places further afield. The bedroom was quite spacious,quiet and very clean.The garden room was a real bonus- an oasis of calm after a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Ronimacaroni
Reviews.Content: --> Great breakfast, with fresh croissants, yoghurt, juices, etc -> Uncomplicated service, e.g. they let me print out tickets for free; always on duty -> Great location; just 10 minutes away from the Eiffel tower, shopping street nearby. -> Rooms are designed in comfortable french style -> Side street, thus nights are very quiet -> Familiar atmosphere, easy to contact with other hotel guests

Reviews.Title: “" A nice quiet spot"”
Reviews.Author: AnotherOntarioguy
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet courtyard off Rue de Passy. This is the second time I stayed here and as I was staying for over a week I opted for the spaciousness of the junior suite. It is much larger than the single room I had in a past visit. I would book this room again. Not much to say that has not already been said. The staff are friendly, the place is clean and quiet, the wi-fi works well and the included breakfast is nice. No eggs but good breads and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ahti
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nicolo is a gem that will appeal to travellers with a sense of romance. It is a small place, located in a courtyard off a side street in Passy. With its six stories and winding staircase, anyone who saw the Day of the Jackal will be thrilled. the slightly dated feel of the hotel was belied by the room I had. Simple, small, but with one of the best beds I can remember. This, plus the off-road location, made for a good night's sleep. Breakfast, so often a massive disappointment in France, was excellent: lovely fresh bread and croissants, good coffee, etc. Staff friendly and helpful. A simple hotel, no pretensions, where much has been done to provide comfort with a certain style. Wish all city hotels were this nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LordJust
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good. Although it is rated only 2 stars, it is very comfortable and an excellent option to stay in Paris without spending too much. The rooms are small and there is no frigobar. On the other hand, everything is very clean. Also, there is free wi-fi. I would like also to say that the breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel stay in Passy, Paris”
Reviews.Author: MoxiGirl
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed our 3 nights stay at Hotel Nicolo, twin room was comfortable, continental breakfast was good, staff were helpful, location was in Passy which we liked, 5 mins walk to Passy Metro, 15-20 min walk to Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: Ale56
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Nicolo for 3 nights in April 2010 paying 85€ per night which I think is a good value for Paris. The hotel is in the quite residential area of Passy close to Trocadero and the Tour Eiffel. My room (a single room) was not huge but with a comfortable double bed. Wi-Fi connection is available at a cheap rate (3€ for the whole duration of your stay) but it is fast and reliable. The bathroom was very clean with a power shower. Breakfast is a continental one with nice cakes, croissants, and fruits. The breakfast room is quite small (I think in summer you can have the breakfast outside in the nice patio too) and you might have to wait or to seat at the same table with other people (I didn't find this a big problem however). Finally the staff is very nice and friendly. I would definitely suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: blurkk33
Reviews.Content: Actually, we only had a chance to stay here for two nights. They guided us to the places we would like to visit. Information that they’ve told us, did a great help. We were able to go to a particular place that we desired without any hassle at all. The cozy and very relaxing ambiance of the room is just perfect for us. After a tiring day, we just went inside our room to have wonderful sleep. We felt very comfortable while staying there because most staff is very approachable and friendly. I remembered when we ask for a room service. The one attend to us greeted us with a smile. Their breakfast is also great! Yeah, I know that isn’t that extraordinary but it’s delicious anyway. During morning, I just spend time to take a walk and see the beauty of their courtyard. They maintained beautiful flowers there. It’s worth the value of your money. I will surely be there again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walker015
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the weekend at this charming hotel with my in laws, husband and children. The hotel was everything it had promised to be. I had organised for rooms on the same floor to be able to stay close to the children and was given exactly those rooms. Breakfast was delicious, fresh and plenty of it even when just getting there at the last minute. Only comment would be that the breakfast room is a bit small for the number of guests in the hotel, but you can choose to have breakfast in your room, or on a good day in the beautiful court yard. Rooms were nicely decorated and very clean with good showers.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam2957
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay here for 4 nights. The location is great - away from the madness of central Paris but still only a 15-20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, and 10 minutes walk to a Metro station, so easy to get anywhere. The hotel staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, the room was lovely and the bathroom was a good size with abath/shower which was great. The hotel itself is in a quiet location, so no sleep disturbed, but had good shops and restaurants nearby if you dont want to go central. The breakfast is good - tea/coffee/hot chocolate with a basket of croissants & bread, as well as fruit/pastries/cereal selection. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, as the cost of hotels in Paris is extortionate, I think this hotel is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: londonx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights as going to Prix de l'Arc races - hotel was the right side of the City. Perfectly placed in really lovely area - felt like 'real Paris' - loads of upmarket shops - fashion and food - and felt very un touristy which was a good thing. 10 mins walk from the Trocadero (fab views of the Eiffel tower) and 12 euro in a cab from Gare du Nord. Room service breakfast at no extra charge was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Small Hotel in a Lovely Location!!”
Reviews.Author: 2TorontoTravellers
Reviews.Content: To start off, the hotel staff were very helpful in giving us directions on how to get there. When we arrived, Catherine was really friendly. We enjoyed the option of having our breakfast in our room, the dining room or in the beautiful courtyard. The room was beautifully decorated and the bathroom was exception and we both enjoyed the bath after a long day of walking. The hotel was within a 15 minute walk of the Eiffel Tower and also close to the Metro. Overall, a great experience! If we returned to Paris, we'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel, away from the madding crowds.”
Reviews.Author: Gilliganuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in a Junior Suite with my 12 yr old daughter and my sister. Loved the character and charm of the hotel and room, and that gorgeous courtyard. If you can go for the junior suite, I would do - having a little bit of extra space is great! (the 3rd bed was a pull out sofa bed, but my sister said she was comfortable enough on it.) The tiny lift gave us the giggles, especially as you still have to drag your suitcase up or down a few steps anyway as it's on a mezzanine level, but it was fine. The continental breakfast was much better than we were expecting with a choice of drinks, juices, bread, croissants, fruit, youghurts, muffins, flans and more. We had half hour of internet useage which cost 5 euros. I don't know if that's par for the course, but I didn't feel ripped off. I loved the surrounding area, and we had lunch near the hotel both days. Turn right out of Rue Nicolo onto Rue de Passy, past the Galerie Passy Plaza (small shopping centre) to the Rue de l'Annonciation. Nice brasserie at the end there (lunch day 1), but wander down that street and it's full of market-type shops where you can fill up with chocolate, wines, bread, meat etc. Loved it there! Had lunch on day 2 in a small place that does crepes & galettes. Delicious. If you're coming from Gare du Nord or Gare de L'Est, I would heartily recommend taking the bus over the metro. We took the metro to the hotel and quickly got fed up with the number of steps everywhere, carrying suitcases. On the way back, we caught the #32 bus which stops virtually opposite the Rue Nicolo and goes to the Gare de l'Est via some great tourist sites! I guess it's not far to walk from there to Gare du Nord, but we just got off when we noticed the bus stops were shared with the #43 which DOES go to the Gare du Nord. I got a good rate through www.booking.com, and would heartily recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “SShhhh. dont tell anyone....”
Reviews.Author: SqealPiggy
Reviews.Content: Lovely three days here last week... Nice 'district' close to eiffel Tower (15 minute walk) and easy subway rides to other attractions.... Quiet, clean, roomy (enough), tidy... Receptionist even lent me a bottle opener for the duration as the (thanks to mr shoebomber) travel rules prevented me from bringing one.... So enjoyed some fine Bordeaux back at the room on an evening... Breakfast pleasant, even do free room service, probably because breakfast room is smallish and can get crowded if all guests ' descend' at the same time... No great views, but quiet due to courtyard locale, some good eateries nearby and sems to be a good district for clothing and tayloring... Wish we'd booked longer... Will be going back again! SP

Reviews.Title: “Interesting neighborhood, off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: rak_75
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Nicolo, in a neighborhood across the Seine from the Eiffel Tower. It felt like I was in a very non-touristy neighborhood filled with locals. Lots of restaurants, cafes, and shops nearby and a short walk to the metro (5-10 mins). The hotel staff were very nice, particularly the front desk clerks in the morning and evenings. The breakfast was okay (I only ate it once) but the plum(?) cake served at breakfast was amazing. My room was on the top floor with a partial, amazing view, of the Eiffel Tower from my small balcony. It was particularly stunning at night when the lights of the Tower turned on at the top of the hour. However, there was no air conditioning in my room (thankfully, there was a ceiling fan) and the metro line closest to the hotel wasn't the most convenient for getting to the major cultural sites (required 1 or 2 metro line transfers). Also, unlike another hotel I stayed at in Paris (Hotel Muguet), the internet in the lobby was not free. Despite these items, I found the hotel very charming and had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: proto411
Reviews.Content: The staff were really friendly and helpful when we would come and go from the hotel. The breakfast that was provided was fresh and a great treat everyday. I liked the room and the out door patio was great to have so close for taking a break from the city. The hotel is close to the metro and we walked to and from the Eiffel tower due to it being not to far from the hotel. There are several restaurants that were close to the hotel that were also a great experience. I recommend this hotel and normally I don't even review places but this one left a great impression.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: meandyoux
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend in Paris for me and my 15 year old daughter and, after reading the review here, booked a room. I wasn't disappointed. The little courtyard is delightful although we were denied the chance to sit out as it rained all weekend. The bedroom was almost entirely filled with the most enormous bed which was extremely comfortable and was great after a long day sightseeing! Everything was so clean and fresh, with lovely crisp white cotton sheets on the bed (which was made every morning) and clean towels every day. The breakfast was good - fresh fruit, pastries, yoghurt, cereal and croissants. We felt very safe in the area although we did not venture out after dark. There are some lovely shops along the Rue de Passy and several bars and cafes. Very friendly and helpful staff. We would certainly stay here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, service and value in the heart of the city...”
Reviews.Author: ROMANTIC-AT-HEART25
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this little hotel after reading the reviews on this site and were very pleased with every thing about this hotel. The gentleman on reception night shift made us feel most welcome from the moment we walked in even though we could speak very little French. This was great to stay in a place that was so clean and of a high standard. We could walk to cafes, restaurants and the Eiffel Tower all within minutes. Perfect hideaway in safe neighbourhood and we will certainly return and recommend to others!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with court yard”
Reviews.Author: toasted83
Reviews.Content: nice quiet hotel, good value, safe, court yard was well decorated w flowers

Reviews.Title: “Deserves more than two stars”
Reviews.Author: Itinerant65
Reviews.Content: I don't know who's in charge of assigning stars to Paris hotels, but he needs to take another look at the Nicolo. We've stayed in 3 and 4-star hotels around Europe that were not nearly as nice. We booked three nights because of the rave reviews on TripAdvisor, and were not disappointed. Our room was clean and comfortable, and overlooked the courtyard. Breakfast was served (not buffet style) off the lobby, in the courtyard, or in your room. The miniscule lift may have, as a previous poster noted, added to the hotel's charm, but was inconvenient when checking in and out because it held just one person and a carryon bag. Definitely not a deal breaker, though. The mostly residential neighborhood was also delightful, with shops and restaurants nearby. A short walk to either of two Metro stations (on the same line, so no strategic advantage to using one or the other). All told, we were very pleased with the Nicolo and will probably return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Oasis - Paris as you'd like it”
Reviews.Author: WoodyBristol
Reviews.Content: The first trip to France & Paris for my wife & 21 month son. Our arrival late afternoon from Charles De Gaule airport via RER & the metro down the dusty Rue de Passy was uninspiring (the June weather has been spectacular). Not familiar with the area I was beginning to think that perhaps I'd made a mistake. Entry into the hotel courtyard, the reception, and four nights later my view is that there is nowhere else I would want to stay in Paris. We had to take a triple room because our 21 month son was classed as a third person, because of hotel insurance I was told. The room was very clean, artwork on the walls, artisian type furniture, writing desk, lots of draw space, mirrored wardrobe, safe, bathroom with bath/shower, a bed the size of Manchester, the result of two beds pushed together, and double doors overlooking the courtyard. Fantastic. Oh yes, and with the black out curtains it was easy to oversleep! The Rue de Passy is the place for great shopping which had a typical French 'suburb' feel about it, bakeries, chocolatiers, small local supermarkets, cafes, brasseries, but you must walk it's length to see the full benefit. For a reasionably priced meal (30euro/person) with drink you can trust Aero on Place de Passy, this on the end of a pedestrian avenue. We loved it and will return at some later date.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Savemesomecashews
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Nicolo in mid-May, 2010. Location is perfect, with lovely patisseries, groceries just around the corner. The walk to the Eiffel tower and beyond is easy. Whole place is immaculately clean. Breakfast was delicious, with a selection of fresh, seasonal fruits (raspberries and cantalope when we were there), breads, croissants, pastries, yogurt, coffee/tea. Service was wonderful, friendly. Wifi was inexpensive and worked great. I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Bobbyandden
Reviews.Content: A little bit difficult to get to from the airport: Three trains and a half mile walk, but well worth the effort. This hotel is in a quiet shopping area of Paris away from the noise and tourists but only a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel tower. Breakfast was very tasty and varied with fresh bread, croissants, pastries, yoghurt, tea, coffee, fruit and fresh fruit juices. The bedroom was tastefully decorated and very comfortable. Staff were very helpful and the hotel was very well maintained and clean, (bed made every day while you're out and fresh towels every day). I would recommend this hotel for a visit to Paris, it had an English Bed and Breakfast feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Azridr
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Hotel Nicolo and enjoyed every minute! Great location near Eiffel tower and Tracadero. Hotel recommended some good restaurants nearby and were very pleasant. Very quiet hotel with a beautiful courtyard when you step in off the street. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mharris7018
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a pleasant stay and would recommend this hotel to others. Researched the reviews here on TripAdvisor and have to agree with most of the assessments. Likes: *Location seems to be fairly good with respect to sightseeing in Paris; 5 - 10 min walk to either of 2 Metro stations (Passy & La Muette) and 1 RER station (Boulainvilliers). *Very quiet location - no perceptive street noise heard. Only people in the courtyard or hallways could be heard within our room and these instances were minimal. * Up-to-date bathroom facilities within the rooms. We stayed in a Junior Suite which was comfortable for space: seperate sitting area, antique desk for lap-top set up, king size bed. * Staff was friendly and helpful; especially Katherine who tends the front desk during the day. She is fluent in English and very accommodating in arranging for guests' needs. * Breakfast is standard continental fare: croissants, baguettes, jam, butter, tea / coffee, pastries, custards & fruit. Particularly enjoyed the plum cake in the AM. * There is a cozy and beautiful courtyard to enjoy breakfast or snacks available for the guests. Unfortunately it was cold and rainy our entire stay so we were not able to indulge. * Fairly good selection of restaurants and shops in the immediate vicinity. Take the time to explore the back streets in the areas. We found some real gems for places to eat; within reasonable budgets. Several Fran Prix and other food stores were close by for grabbing cheese, snacks, wine, etc. Plenty of pharmacies and other shops in the area. * Felt completely safe walking about in this locale. * Only charged 3 Euros for internet access; in total for a 4 night stay. Best rate I encountered for internet access during 2 weeks travel in Europe. Connectivity was good. Dislikes (relatively minor issues): * No shower curtain around the tub. Made for a wet floor after showering and lack of privacy when two are trying to use the bathroom * No facial tissues provided within the bathroom * Hallway noise could be distracting when children were boisterous.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect...”
Reviews.Author: SAJoburg
Reviews.Content: We were extremely impressed with this hotel, the service was excellent, the room above our expectations and the price was just right. This just shows how useful using TripAdvisor is as I booked the trip purely on the TripAdvisor reviews and was not dissapointed. This is where we will stay next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small but so so nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mufiin
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights with a friend. The Hotel is small, but the rooms are clean and very very nice, and the staff is diffidently there to help. Is located about 12 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower, 5 min from a metro, and in a very nice shopping and dinning area. You can find everything just around the corner. I would diffidently recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So value for money does exist in Paris......!”
Reviews.Author: DavidN_10
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant, unpretentious little hotel with friendly, helpful staff and a good location, all at a very reasonable rate.....there is nothing not to like about the Nicolo. The breakfast included in the rate was very good but don't leave it till the last half hour before they finish serving at 10.00am to go down as most other guests seem to, because the dining area is quite small and fills up quickly, sometimes necessitating a wait for a table......only a very minor irritation in what was otherwise a hassle free and enjoyable stay.Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “JUST PERFECT !”
Reviews.Author: WEEROSIE
Reviews.Content: Easter weekend .. stayed in the Hotel Nicolo and it was just perfect. A 'jewel' of a hotel tucked away yet unbelievably central. The hotel is 'boutique', comfortable and tranquil. Great breakfast (fresh fruit, juice, croisants, breads, tea/coffee). Staff were very helpful and on-hand when we needed info about restaurants, taxis, church, etc. The hotel is approx. 10 mins walk to the Eifel Tower and is surrounded by great sandwich/coffee shops. The local church is approx. 2mins walk away (which was nice for the Easter Sunday service). Hotel room was very comfortable, clean and typically Parisian. Would definately recomm. this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Central”
Reviews.Author: MarWaGe
Reviews.Content: Small and central hotel for business & city trips. Close to Metro stations and walking distance to the OECD conference center. Nice garden.

Reviews.Title: “Give this hotel another star! A fantastic find for Paris visitors.”
Reviews.Author: DougCG
Reviews.Content: I split my stay in Paris between a 5-star hotel and the Nicolo, and after coming from the 5-star, my immediate impression of the Nicolo was, "This is *only* a 2-star?!?" This is a hotel that goes out of its way to make guests feel comfortable. The rooms are nicely decorated and look out over a beautiful courtyard, the breakfasts are generous and filling, the hotel feels clean and safe, and the staff radiates an attitude of being there to make sure guests are comfortable and worry-free. Check-in and check-out are seamless, drinks (water, soda, etc.) are available for purchase at reception and - in a nice change of pace from most hotels - are priced reasonably and clearly. Wifi is also available to guests at a reasonable price, although I'd suggest to the hotel that it offer wifi service free to guests- the price is so low that it would probably be of more value to the hotel to be able to advertise that it has free wifi for guests. Not a complaint, just a suggestion to encourage the success of an an establishment that I hope will be successful for a long time. The location is near-perfect. Within easy walking distance of several Metro and RER stops, it is located in a pleasant, bustling neighborhood. I recommend not only the short walk to the Eiffel Tower, but the evening walk back as well - we looked forward to ending our days by getting off at a Metro/RER stop near the tower and walking back to the hotel with the beautiful view of the lit-up tower as our backdrop. In short, I'd recommend the Nicolo at twice the price we paid. It's true gem for budget-conscious travelers looking for a clean, convenient, and pleasant place to stay in Paris that I'd book again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great price, great location...”
Reviews.Author: travelleralex
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Nicolo regularly for over 5 years now, and I must say that we have never been disappointed. The staff are friendly, always willing to help, the rooms are big (for Paris), the bathrooms too. The hotel is clean, decorated simplistically, but nicely... Breakfast is basic but good. Location is fantastic. Highly recommend this hotel... the best value for money you can get in Paris without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: em7748
Reviews.Content: I loved my long weekend stay at the Hotel Nicolo back in 2008, and I will be heading back there as it was so lovely and everything | was looking for. The staff could not do enough for us and were so accomodating, it made our stay so much more lovelier. The price is also great value for money, we had a great sized twin bedroom,, the view was of the courtyard below (which is lovely and quaint, and great if you want to rest in between sight seeing Paris). and the bathroom was much bigger than you expect from a paris hotel. Breakfast was continental (mais oui!) and was delicious, included in the price of the room so a complete bargain. I loved the location also, 10 mins walk to the Passy metro station and 15 mins walk to the Effiel Tower. I loved being in the Passy district, I felt like I was in a Parisian neightbourhood, not in the tourist trap, it was so lovely to come back to each evening. Great little shops and cafes too, oh and the pattiseries!! I loved my stay at the Hotel Nicolo and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in a clean, modern and charming hotel in Paris that offers value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LindaandNick
Reviews.Content: Small boutique style hotel. Very clean. Good location, short walk to metro and within walking distance to the Eiffel tower. Located in nice area. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: victoriaocarroll
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in Hotel Nicolo and we were extremely happy with our choice. The area was safe, there were nice restaurants and bars and a food market nearby. The eiffel tower was within short walking distance and everyone working at hotel nicolo was lovely. I did quite some research into various hotels as we had a budget to stick to and I am really happy we chose Hotel Nicolo. We were always greeted with a smile, or a joke, when we came in, the rooms were spotless and cleaned every day and the hotel was situated in a really nice, safe area. The rooms themselves are small, but average by Parisian standards. They were quaint and clean, which is the most important thing in my opinion. I have recommended the hotel to my friends and family and will come again. A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “more than expected!”
Reviews.Author: rachele78
Reviews.Content: I spent two night at the Nicolo Hotel and I must say that this is one of the best 'value for money ' choice I've ever done. I paid 104 euros for a double room, breakfast included, which for a city like Paris is an amazing price. Breakfast was really good, with fresh orange juice, croissants and bread. The room service is free of charge. My room was located on the 6th floor and I could see the Eiffel tower. The hotel position is pretty central. You can also walk to the Eiffel tower (10 minutes). The location is very nice, very quiet area. The owner is a nice guy, pretty friendly for being a Parisienne..:) There is also a very nice dehors, with a gazebo where you can chill. The only negative point is that the rooms are small. They are clean, but the space for moving around is not that much. To me it was ok, as I used the room only to rest, but if you are planning to spend a lot of time in the room this is not the hotel you might like. The overall experience has been definetively positive. I strongly recommend the Nicolo hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great room.... just great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mojo-Ravi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with our infant son and everything was simply delightful. The hotel staff attended to our every need and request. Breakfast, by Paris standards, was substantial and of good quality. The location is great for walking Paris or for catching the Metro. The room was spacious and quiet and we found the courtyard area to be quite relaxing. Definitely recommend the Nicolo to anyone looking for a comfortable and affordable hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel, friendly and very clean, stylish decor”
Reviews.Author: yoyo53Lincolnshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights. Quiet location and lovely internal courtyard/garden. All the reception staff spoke some English for which we were grateful, high standard of breakfast and cleanliness throughout. Loved the decor and the tiny lift added to the hotel's character. Felt secure and there was a free safety deposit box in the wardrobe. Being English we missed the coffee facilities in the room but that was the only slight downside. The staff were friendly without being too fussy. Took seconds to check in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel. Close to Metro and easy access to the great sites in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Mabenlady
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Nice breakfast in the morning. Convenient to the Metro and the front desk was always courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Strategically situated”
Reviews.Author: mrsbeachbum
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed especially within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and the central part of Trocadero. However, the lift was not big enough and the service always forgot to replenish on toileteries which were used overnight. Breakfast was a nightmare as we would always wake up early in the morning to be served with the same things i.e croissants, tea/coffee, orange juice, butter and jam. Nothing exceptional about the hotel itself except for its strategic location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Clean, Larger Rooms and Incredibly Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: BLF57
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, friendly, knowledgeable staff who spoke English (and didn't mind doing so!); close to lots of good, local Parisien restaurants and shops; close to Metro and Eiffel Tower; room was larger than anything else we've experienced in Paris - and we had a double sink! We've visited Paris quite a few times; the neighborhood is the best we've experienced, and the hotel very much worth the reasonable price. An fyi for Americans: as is often found in European hotels, two beds are put together to make a double when requested...ours was very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: in_mordor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for nine nights. Arrived after 1am with no problems at all (the room was ready and the person at the reception knew who we were before we said anything - very friendly, by the way). Our room was in front of the little garden the hotel has. We had the breakfast there every morning which was just delightful. The breakfast, itself, was very good. Fresh products, homemade cake, delicious bread and fruit. All served by a very nice lady. The hotel is quite charming. Decorated in a very personal style, quite different from the mainstream impersonal hotels we are used to book. After a tiring day of sightseeing across Paris, it was comforting the idea of returning to such a beautiful, relaxing place. In Paris, i will choose no other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming....”
Reviews.Author: bulgit
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel based on the reviews from trip advisor and i am glad we did. Everything that had been said on this web site is true. My #1 reason i gave this hotel a 3 for service is that, the day we arrived, the guy who was working in front desk was very very very rude he almost made us regret coming to france. We thought everybody was going to be like him. we were traveling with a 4year old and we got in early around 6am. It was our first time in europe, so we were very excited as you can imagine. As soon as we got off from the shuttle, we were happy to see a nice charming little hotel wth a beautiful garden. But when we stepped inside, the guy at the desk greeted us with a frown and just asked for our papers.. When I handed it to him, he asked me why they didn't include the child and became argumantative. I hated to have to deal with that with a very sleepy child in my arms. Fortunatley, everything else after him was brighter. All other staff especially the Indian looking gentlman were very curtious and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: pirsq
Reviews.Content: We used Hotel Nicolo for two seperate one night stays last week to split the train journey (recommended by the way) from England to the South of France. Both nights where quiet, the rooms clean and perfectly adequate (the second being on the top floor had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower!). A lovely continental style breakfast each morning that could be taken inside or outside in the little courtyard and very helpful and friendly staff made for 2 very enjoyable nights in Paris. There were no facilities for drinks in the room, these were available at reception, but overall this is a great little hotel for a safe and quiet sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sightseerUK
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from the reviews on Trip Adviser and I'm very glad we did as it more than lived up to our expectations. Arriving after midnight because of a problem with our flight we were grateful for a warm welcome. We were delighted by the very stylish decor and the quiet and colourful courtyard garden. We liked the location. Passy was quiet in August and had some very nice shops, but as has been said already wasn't very lively at night so we travelled further afield. This meant a bit of journey home in the late evening but the metro is only 5 minutes walk and the area felt very safe. Breakfast (included in the price) was very good too. Will definitely use this hotel again and strongly recommend it. Warning: our room was on the 5th floor and the lift is extremely small and would not suit anyone with claustrophobia!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Little Hotel Tucked Away”
Reviews.Author: n5371856
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with great staff and excellent location. Breakfast each morning is absolutely delicous. The staff are friendly and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLou
Reviews.Content: The main reason we chose to stay at this hotel was due to the reviews we saw on Tripadvisor and I'm so glad we did. A great hotel in a nice area, very close to the Metro station and a short walk from the Eiffel Tower. The staff were alos very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, plesent Hotel in a safe area”
Reviews.Author: LondonNigel64
Reviews.Content: The hotel Nicolo is set back of the street throhg a passage way , but the whole are feels safe for a central capitol city. Walking distance ( 15 Mins ) to the Eiffel Tower, and 5 mins from 2 metro stations. There aren’t much public areas or bar, and the smallest lift you’ve ever seen, but the rooms are of a good size, quiet at night and the staff helpful. Not many restaurants close to the hotel, but we had an excellent and good value meal at Bistro De La Muette, 10 minutes walk away, as recommended by the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: valval30
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Hotel. Quiet, not far from main attractions. The rooms are small, but that's Europe, I've traveled all around it. I read the reviews from other fellow trip advisors before booking and I'm so glad I did. If you love to shop the hotel is located on a street with nothing but stores. The garden in front of the hotel is quiet and relaxing. Please inquire with the front desk regarding lunch or dinner. They will recommend a little bistro within walking distance that is WONDERFUL! I had dinner and lunch here. Please try the Ravioli appetizer. This is a great little hotel. Will be staying here anytime I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, nice area, could be more central”
Reviews.Author: tallulaha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Easter weekend and had a great time. For the money this is a great hotel. The hotel is very nicely decorated, down a side street with a lovely garden area where you can eat your breakfast (max 8 people). It could be more centrally located but then it would be more expensive. Local metro station is passy and you can get to almost anywhere from here. Breakfast was okay and consists of croissants and bread and jam, hot drink and orange juice. The staff are very friendly. You can get wifi for 3 euros whilst at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: CAMANOCLIFFY
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value! Great location withing walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. My wife and I spent 5 nights at Hotel Nicolo. Selected this hotel in response to information on TripAdvisor. Needed a nice hotel without breaking the bank. Nicolo is clean and quaint. Friendly and helpful staff. Wonderful haven after a busy day of visiting Paris attractions. Breakfast included. If you're looking for a 5 star experience with all the glitz, this isn't the place for you. If you're looking for a clean, well-located hotel, and you're on a budget... book Hotel Nicolo. We'll stay here again if we're fortunate enough to visit Paris again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chachachachacha
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Staff are so friendly and helpful. Room was gorgeous and very generous bathroom with a great power shower. Breakfast is typical continental (rolls, crossants, tea, coffee) and is served 7am - 10am in the dining room, garden or your bedroom. You leave your room key at reception when you're going out which omits the possibility of losing it (reception is open 24 hrs). Hotel is only around the corner from a great variety of shops in the Trocedero area and a 5 min walk to Passy metro station. Eifel Tower is 10 mins away which was amazing considering how reasonably priced the hotel was. So much to do around the area - sightseeing, shopping, eating and of course only 40 mins away from Disneyland. Highly recommend this hotel for short or long stays.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey080
Reviews.Content: Went to a Wedding this weekend in Paris. It was all booked for us so really didn't know what to expect. Arrived from airport on RER train, then got metro to Trocadero. It's a bit of a walk from the metro to hotel but not bad, takes about 10 minutes. When we arrived I just saw a tacky hotel sign and thought "Oh dear", but as we walked through the archway into the courtyard, I was pleasantly suprised!!! The little courtyard has been filled with plants and flowers and has a little seating area which is lovely. See photos already on here, however it looked better because all the flowers were in bloom. The hotel and rooms were very modern and tasteful. Every little detail was thought of. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. I would definately go again it is worth a second visit.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris traveling with kids”
Reviews.Author: ykeene
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful little gem of a hotel. Perfect place to stay if you are traveling with kids and want to stay in one room. We had a suite for 4 people. Very large and very nicely decorated. I don't know why it is rated only a two star. Great value. The staff was extremely friendly and the neighborhood is ideal for getting around Paris. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly little hotel”
Reviews.Author: hunter6sam
Reviews.Content: Catherine was charming and helpful, friendly with a great sense of humor. She helped us with reservations and is an absolute gem! Everyone on the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is great, and the little garden in the entryway is delightful. The room and bathroom were nice-sized and spotlessly clean. Would definitely recommend the Nocolo.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Nicolo
HotelInfo.Address: 3 rue Nicolo | 16th Arr., 75016 Paris, France
